channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There's an internet blackout in Iran. How are videos and images getting out?
item.description: Starlink is illegal in Iran, but people are still using the satellite internet service to get around the government's internet shutdown.

item.title: Trump health care plan doesn't help people facing skyrocketing ACA premiums
item.description: President Trump announced a plan that addresses drug costs and health savings accounts, but not the health insurance premium spikes millions of Americ...

item.title: Verizon just had a big outage. Here's what we know
item.description: Verizon says a software problem caused the glitch and they are conducting a postmortem, but experts say outages are "a fact of life" these days.

item.title: Iran's protests appear increasingly smothered after a deadly crackdown
item.description: The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and es...

item.title: Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act (again). What is it?
item.description: As protests grow over violent ICE enforcement actions in Minneapolis, the president said he could invoke a centuries-old law that would give him sweep...

item.title: As immigration agents police Minneapolis protests, experts warn of training gaps and the rising risk
US forces seize a sixth Venezuela-linked oil tanker in Caribbean Sea
item.description: The tanker, Veronica, was seized in a predawn operation "without incident", the US military's Southern Command says.

item.title: Votes being counted in Uganda election as opposition alleges rigging
item.description: The election is a rematch between Bobi Wine and Yoweri Museveni, who has been president for 40 years.

item.title: Is a $10,000 long-term CD account worth opening for 2026?
item.description: It may not appear beneficial on the surface, but a $10,000 long-term CD account can still be worth it. Here's why.

item.title: Trump threatens to use the Insurrection Act to end protests in Minneapolis
item.description: President Donald Trump has threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act and deploy troops to quell persistent protests against Immigration and Customs En...

item.title: Ethiopia says seized ammunition sent by Eritrea to rebels as tensions rise
item.description: Eritrea denies the claim and accuses Ethiopia of seeking a pretext to attack, amid fears of renewed conflict.

item.title: Trump threatens to use Insurrection Act to deploy troops to Minnesota
item.description: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer​ shot a man Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after allegedly being attacked by men with shovels dur...

item.title: Iran judiciary denies plan to execute detained protester Erfan Soltani
item.description: The judiciary says Soltani is not facing charges carrying the death penalty, while a rights group reports that the execution has been "postponed".

item.title: María Machado visits Trump after offering to share Nobel with him
item.description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Machado has said she wants to give her Nobel Prize to Trump and "share it with him," for removing Nicolás Maduro fr...

item.title: ChatGPT served as "suicide coach" in man's death, lawsuit alleges
item.description: Mother of Colorado man who committed suicide in 2025 alleges that OpenAI's AI chatbot told him death was a "beautiful place."

item.title: European military personnel arrive in Greenland as Trump says US needs island
item.description: France says a small military contingent has arrived and more forces will be there in the coming days.

item.title: Senators say bipartisan compromise on ACA tax credits has stalled
item.description: "We are in a little bit of a pothole," said GOP Sen. Bernie Moreno, who previously expected the compromise to be unveiled this week.

item.title: Proposals targeting immigration flood in following ICE shooting of Renee Good in Minneapolis
